sentences.en: After women obtained the right to vote, the suffragette movement became a dead duck in Britain.
sentences.cn: 妇女获得选举权后, 鼓吹妇女参政的妇女运动,在英国成了不能再引起人们举趣的问题了.

sentences.en: In 1897, when Cambridge’s Senate voted on whether to grant women degrees, (male) students rioted and an effigy of a suffragette in bloomers on a bicycle was suspended from the Senate House windows.
sentences.cn: 1897年剑桥就是否授予妇女学位进行投票，但遭到了男学生的反对。 男学生们捣乱闹事，还夸张地把骑自行车的穿着灯笼裤的女权主义者的模拟像悬挂在议事大楼窗上，以示抗议。

sentences.en: In July 1909 , imprisoned English suffragette Marion Dunlop refused to eat.
sentences.cn: 1909.7, 被捕的英国女权主义者马里恩·邓洛普开始绝食.

sentences.en: Out of the ashes of the Suffragette Movement , phoenix - like, a new feminist militancy was being born.
sentences.cn: (宗教就像传说中的凤凰一样, 在战争的灰烬中又复活了. )

sentences.en: She was a suffragette and a birth control pioneer.
sentences.cn: 她参加争取妇女选举权的运动，也是节育倡导者。

sentences.en: Walden was secretly amused by the suffragette.
sentences.cn: 沃尔登对那个女权运动者暗自感到高兴.

trans.tran_en: a female advocate of the extension of the franchise to women, esp a militant one, as in Britain at the beginning of the 20th century
